meanings.definition: The geographical area represented by an elected official.
meanings.sent1: The electorates of the city councilor include several neighborhoods.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, each elected official is responsible for a specific electorates.
meanings.sent3: The electorates decided to throw a party to celebrate their representative's win.
meanings.sent4: The boundaries of the electorates are like invisible lines shaping the political landscape.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set over the electorates, the councilor prepared for a town hall meeting.

meanings.definition: The group of people eligible to vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: The electorates turned out in large numbers to cast their votes.
meanings.sent2: Candidates often focus on appealing to the electorates during campaigns.
meanings.sent3: The electorates were excited to exercise their right to vote.
meanings.sent4: In a close election, every member of the electorates can make a difference.
meanings.sent5: The electorates' voices echoed through the polling station on election day.
